body:
### Problem

I just updated to Neovim 0.10 and I'm having issues where Neovim exits without any errors or warnings. I've restarted my laptop, it didn't fix the problems. See - https://imgur.com/a/XOZUJO7

### Steps to reproduce

Opening any file - nvim filename

### Expected behavior

Work persistently

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

0.10

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

No, Vim 9.0.1991

### Operating system/version

12.7

### Terminal name/version

kitty 0.33

### $TERM environment variable

nothing

### Installation

Homebrew

comment_data.body: Sorry, without _any_ context, there is nothing to go on. First, test `nvim --clean`.

I too am running into this. I'm using astronvim v3.40.2. This crash occurs ~3 seconds after opening a file, with no input required to trigger the crash.

This crash _does not_ happen when running with `nvim --clean`.

I'm going to try updating plugins and astronvim to see if this resolves the crash.

Here's my Crash Report:

Please provide a minimal reproducing example. I see a few libraries that are not included with Neovim in there; if there error is there, the fix needs to be made in the plugin.

I am choosing to not invest time in providing a minimal reproducing example; updating Astronvim and the plugins I was using resolved this issue for me.

Steps that fixed my crashes:
1. Open `nvim` (no file, just empty buffer)
2. Run `:AstroUpdate`
3. Run `:Lazy update`

labels.description: We need minimal steps to reproduce the issue
labels.name: needs:repro

title: Weird issue after updating to Neovim 0.10
